inbaser 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Find all inteins in Archaea genomes

    InBaseR

    InBaseR provides convenient inbase and inbase_seq data objects for the 585 inteins in the unmaintained inteins.com InBase database. The protein sequences are available as AAStringSet objects in inbase_seq, but otherwise nothing else is changed from the InBase metadata.

    Installation

    You can install the development version of inbaser from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("omsai/inbaser")

    Example

    Load the InBase database using:

    data(inbase, inbase_seq)

    Links
